question: What are the names of disaster projects advertised before 2023
raw_answer: Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design, Clover Heights Storm Drain, Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs, Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements, Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs
evidence_answer: Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design, Clover Heights Storm Drain, Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs, Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements, Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs
evidence:
(cid:131) On November 30, 2021, City Council approved an agreement with
Acoustic Technology to design the outdoor warning sirens.

A design
report will be presented to Council upon completion.

(cid:131) The Kickoff meeting for the Steering Committee was held on March 17,

2022.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule: TBD

Disaster Projects (Construction)
None at this time

Disaster Projects (Completed)

Citywide Guardrail Replacement
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and
Kanan Dume Road.

The
project will be advertised for construction bids with construction
beginning in Fall 2022.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: July 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2022
(cid:131)

Outdoor Warningn Sirens - Design (FEMA Project)

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights.

The existing storm drain facility ends at the
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff released a Request for Proposals for engineering design services.

Proposals are due in April 14, 2022. Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing the existing storm drain
on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH that was
damaged by the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) This project is currently under design with the City’s consultant.

Staff

is finalizing the bid documents. (cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: March 2022
(cid:131) Advertise: Spring 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2022

Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is finalizing the design of this project.

(cid:131) Staff is also working with FEMA/CalOES to substitute the existing

timber with non-combustible materials.

Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs (CalJPIA/FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project consultant has started the design of this project.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2022

(cid:190) Project Description: An Emergency Warning Siren system will improve the
City’s ability to alert the community by providing mechanisms to alert
residents in areas without power and those who live in neighborhoods with
poor cell service.

Phase One of the project included a sound study to
determine the optimal number and locations of individual sirens, power and
infrastructure requirements, and siren sound range.

The City has been
awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and
environmental compliance needed for a shovel ready project.
